contentrichtext.text: {{Use mdy dates|date=June 2013}} '''Nick Evangelista''' (b. 1949<ref>{{cite LAF|id=n94-16632}}</ref>) is a fencing master, author, and magazine publisher. Evangelista teaches the classical French school of fencing in [[Springfield, Missouri]]. He was trained by [[Olympic fencer]] [[Ralph Faulkner]]. Evangelista is also the publisher of ''Fencers Quarterly Magazine''.<ref>[http://www.fencersquarterly.com/ ''Fencers Quarterly Magazine'']</ref> He has a son, Justin. ==Works== One of the more prolific and outspoken proponents of [[classical fencing]], Evangelista has authored several books, including: *''[[The Art and Science of Fencing]]'' ISBN 1-57028-075-4 *''[[The Inner Game of Fencing]]'' ISBN 1-57028-230-7 *''[[The Encyclopedia of the Sword]]'' ISBN 0-313-27896-2 *{{cite book |first1=Nick |last1= Evangelista |authorlink1=Nick Evangelista |first2=Anita |last2=Evangelista |first3=Roberta (Afterword) |last3=Brown |authorlink3=Roberta Brown |title=The Woman Fencer |format=Paperback |pages=288 |location=Terre Haute, Indiana|publisher=Wish Publishing |edition=1st |date=September 1, 2001 |language=English |isbn=1930546483}} ISBN 978-1930546486 == See also == *[[Swordsmanship]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Authority control|VIAF=36140309}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Evangelista, Nick | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American fencer | DATE OF BIRTH = 1949 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Evangelista, Nick}} [[Category:American fencers]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Modern fencing]] [[Category:1949 births]] {{US-fencing-bio-stub}}
